comments:
This course involves: design of reactors for the production of chemical products,
continuous and batch reactors, chemical kinetics, effects of backmixing and non-ideal
flow in tubular reactors, heterogeneous reactions, and construction and economic analysis
of reactors.
In general, students enjoyed this course, noting it to be “difficult but rewarding.”
One student commented that it “pushes the student to understand the fundamental
concepts and behaviors behind the mathematics,” while another praised it as his “favorite
course in the CBE curriculum.” A few students criticized the textbook for overly
simplifying the material, as it attempted to cram “200 pages worth of material into 400.”
One student thought that the class should have been “a little more discussionoriented.”
Students agreed that this was “one of the harder courses in CBE,” so it was not
recommended for students outside the major.
*This course review was written based on the 8 student comments received.
